businessProfile.name: Fat Chris's Pizza and Such
businessProfile.address: 1706 W Foster Ave, Chicago, IL 60640, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 1706 W Foster Ave, Chicago, IL 60640, USA

reviews.text: I‚Äôve only ever taken out from here, but I LOVE this pizza spot! Their pizza has great flavor and a crispy crust ‚Äî AND they have gluten free Detroit crust! I like it way better than Chicago Pizzas gluten free deep dish.

Really great option for Detroit style pizza. The recommended cheesy bread was excellent, if you're a fan of Faygo, this is one of the free places I've seen it in the city.

My favorite was the Samoan though both the Hawaiian and Carnie were great as well. Their sauce is sweet rather than savory just as a heads up.

The restaurant is unassuming but has a distinct character with why brick walls and fun decor.

Service was great with helpful and cheerful staff.
Absolutely Fire a bit pricey but everything was fresh my only complaint is I wish they had an Italian beef and giardiniera peppers for a topping. Had a LG Detroit style meat lovers.

I live in the neighborhood. I‚Äôve eaten here quite a few times. Today was my last visit.

I placed a pick up order on DoorDash. I walked to the restaurant and arrived about 2 minutes before my order was supposed to be ready. The place was completely empty and the front door was locked. I called the restaurant and someone hung up on me. I called a second time and asked whether the place was open. The owner replied ‚ÄúUgh, yeah‚Ä¶‚Äù in a condescending tone, as if I were crazy for asking. I informed him his front door was locked.

When the owner came to open the door, another delivery driver had arrived. We walked into the empty restaurant and the owner told the delivery driver, ‚ÄúYour order will be ready in about 4 minutes, you can have a seat.‚Äù He told me, ‚ÄúYour order will be ready in about 6 minutes, please wait outside.‚Äù I asked him whether it was necessary for me to go outside and he told me that when an order takes more than 6 minutes to complete, he asks people to wait in their car. I wanted to explain to him that I didn‚Äôt have a car and that I‚Äôm a returning customer from the neighborhood, but he stormed off after he finished his statement.

Again, the restaurant was empty. There were plenty of empty chairs. Instead, I stood outside his front door and nobody came to inform me my order was ready.

This owner seems checked out.

I‚Äôve been looking for a good Detroit style pizza in Chicago for a long time, and Fat Chris‚Äôs is definitely the place to go! The pizza was cooked perfectly and was ready quickly.

The prices are also pretty reasonable. I would recommend everyone try it out!

editorial_summary.overview: A menu featuring Detroit-style square pizzas & subs in an easygoing setting with modern interiors.

recentReviews.text: We went in with my fianc√©e when we were out for a walk, they cook very tasty and quickly
Delicious pizza and terrific staff! Love being able to watch Detroit sports! And playing the Lions fight song is the cherry on topüíô

Attentive, polite staff and the best damn Detroit pizza in the city. Honestly, one of the best pizzas in the city, period. Their thin crust is good too, but their square pies are the star of the show. The toasted cheese on the edge somehow tastes better than any other place that does it.

The young lady up front her name is Zoey is amazing. Food out of this world. A party in your mouth. I ordered a Chicago Dog, buffalo chicken pizza with brisket and chubbies. My god the chubbies are a slam dunk. If you have not tried this restaurant you‚Äôre missing out on great people and great food. The orders came out and told me thank you come on, you could not wish for a better place
The front end person is very helpful and the ingredients all tasted fresh.
I‚Äôd go back for the Pizza slices and mozzarella sticks. The Fries I could do without.
Delicious Detroit style pizza with creative ingredients served by a friendly staff

I live in the neighborhood. I‚Äôve eaten here quite a few times. Today was my last visit.

I placed a pick up order on DoorDash. I walked to the restaurant and arrived about 2 minutes before my order was supposed to be ready. The place was completely empty and the front door was locked. I called the restaurant and someone hung up on me. I called a second time and asked whether the place was open. The owner replied ‚ÄúUgh, yeah‚Ä¶‚Äù in a condescending tone, as if I were crazy for asking. I informed him his front door was locked.

When the owner came to open the door, another delivery driver had arrived. We walked into the empty restaurant and the owner told the delivery driver, ‚ÄúYour order will be ready in about 4 minutes, you can have a seat.‚Äù He told me, ‚ÄúYour order will be ready in about 6 minutes, please wait outside.‚Äù I asked him whether it was necessary for me to go outside and he told me that when an order takes more than 6 minutes to complete, he asks people to wait in their car. I wanted to explain to him that I didn‚Äôt have a car and that I‚Äôm a returning customer from the neighborhood, but he stormed off after he finished his statement.

Again, the restaurant was empty. There were plenty of empty chairs. Instead, I stood outside his front door and nobody came to inform me my order was ready.

This owner seems checked out.

Great wife and husband owned pizzaria with a great product weather you like hand tossed Tavern or Detroit style pizza. Go sit down enjoy a couple beers and get some pizza and have a great time‚Ä¶ just don‚Äôt order the wings lol unless you like rubber microwaved wings

detailedReviews.author: Kevin Howell
detailedReviews.text: We went in with my fianc√©e when we were out for a walk, they cook very tasty and quickly

detailedReviews.author: Christina Kneitz
detailedReviews.text: Delicious pizza and terrific staff! Love being able to watch Detroit sports! And playing the Lions fight song is the cherry on topüíô

detailedReviews.author: Violeta Segovia
detailedReviews.text: Attentive, polite staff and the best damn Detroit pizza in the city. Honestly, one of the best pizzas in the city, period. Their thin crust is good too, but their square pies are the star of the show. The toasted cheese on the edge somehow tastes better than any other place that does it.

detailedReviews.author: Jeffrey Knobloch
detailedReviews.text: The young lady up front her name is Zoey is amazing. Food out of this world. A party in your mouth. I ordered a Chicago Dog, buffalo chicken pizza with brisket and chubbies. My god the chubbies are a slam dunk. If you have not tried this restaurant you‚Äôre missing out on great people and great food. The orders came out and told me thank you come on, you could not wish for a better place

detailedReviews.author: Cameron Stamm
detailedReviews.text: The front end person is very helpful and the ingredients all tasted fresh.

detailedReviews.author: Tee Kay
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôd go back for the Pizza slices and mozzarella sticks. The Fries I could do without.

detailedReviews.author: Jeffrey Orloff
detailedReviews.text: Delicious Detroit style pizza with creative ingredients served by a friendly staff

detailedReviews.author: R. Flores
detailedReviews.text:
I live in the neighborhood. I‚Äôve eaten here quite a few times. Today was my last visit.

I placed a pick up order on DoorDash. I walked to the restaurant and arrived about 2 minutes before my order was supposed to be ready. The place was completely empty and the front door was locked. detailedReviews.author: Rachel Null
detailedReviews.text: Great wife and husband owned pizzaria with a great product weather you like hand tossed Tavern or Detroit style pizza. Go sit down enjoy a couple beers and get some pizza and have a great time‚Ä¶ just don‚Äôt order the wings lol unless you like rubber microwaved wings

detailedReviews.author: Julia Emmler
detailedReviews.text: Still awesome! Thanks Fat Chris‚Äôs

detailedReviews.author: Brandon
detailedReviews.text: Their Detroit pizza is my go to- get the toppings you like and dig in I have no üôÇ‚Äç‚ÜîÔ∏è there opinions.

detailedReviews.author: Scott Otis
detailedReviews.text: Everything is good

detailedReviews.author: t B
detailedReviews.text: This place is awesome, the pizza is wonderful and the sandwiches are devine

detailedReviews.author: Jos√© David Caceres Hidalgo
detailedReviews.text: I had a bad experience here. Apparently, the food preparation isn't the best. It gave me indigestion. I could also talk about the poor customer service. If you want to come here to eat and then leave sick, don't hesitate to visit this cheap pizzeria.

detailedReviews.author: Christopher Stratton
detailedReviews.text: Very friendly service. Order was ready right on time and the pizza was delicious. Will definitely go back!

detailedReviews.author: Nick Kosiek
detailedReviews.text: Our favorite Detroit style pizza in Chicago!

detailedReviews.author: Theresa S
detailedReviews.text:
The owners response is now another reason to never be back.

Hair in food and serving stale bread is acceptable them and then they bully customers who notify the public about it.

Look at their other 1 star reviews, they berate anyone who dares say they received poor service here. This is a winning strategy I'm sure.

Thanks for taking my money though. I'm sure I'll never see the refund you promised for the hot dog that ended up in the trash with the poppers, and for ruining my dinner after working a 12 hour shift.

-----------------------------------

We‚Äôve ordered from here occasionally for the last three years. Tonight will be the last. Before we always ordered pizza and had no issues, but tonight decided on hot dogs and appetizers instead.

The Chicago dog bun was stale and the jalape√±o poppers had hair in the ranch dressing and was in the package with the poppers.

I did call about the hot dog and they offered to refund that. Unfortunately I went to try the poppers afterwards and found the hair.

I‚Äôm sorry but this is so gross and unacceptable, we will never be back.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Duran
detailedReviews.text: Fat Chris‚Äô is consistently good. It‚Äôs a must try

detailedReviews.author: Charlie Dubz
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely Fire a bit pricey but everything was fresh my only complaint is I wish they had an Italian beef and giardiniera peppers for a topping. Had a LG Detroit style meat lovers.

detailedReviews.author: Greg Allen
detailedReviews.text: Had never been to fat Chris‚Äôs pizza before and decided to give it a try after looking at the menu online and white that they had such variety of choices for pizza, sandwiches, etc. was super impressed when we visited the food was great and the service was super

detailedReviews.author: Laura Heintzelman
detailedReviews.text: Great service & amazing Detroit style pizza!!!

detailedReviews.author: Jenny Jones
detailedReviews.text: The food is always fantastic. Service is nice. This is one of our favorite local pizzerias.

detailedReviews.author: Jazmine Rodriguez
detailedReviews.text: Food sucks the lady in there is faking that  she‚Äôs the manager but wants a child to purchase a $2.50 soda in order to use the bathroom a child bro don‚Äôt not eat here the ‚Äúmanager‚Äù is racist towards black children to use the bathroom crazy

detailedReviews.author: Dynamic Duo Channel
detailedReviews.text:
I called this restaurant to ask a simple question about their pizza options and whether they had a buffet. The person who answered the phone was extremely rude and dismissive. I wasn‚Äôt being rude at all, I was just trying to get information. Instead of helping me, he gave me attitude and even hung up on me twice.

This is not how you treat customers. I never even visited the restaurant because of how I was treated over the phone. Based on this experience, I will not be going there. If you value good customer service, I suggest avoiding this place.

detailedReviews.author: Julia
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôve only ever taken out from here, but I LOVE this pizza spot! Their pizza has great flavor and a crispy crust ‚Äî AND they have gluten free Detroit crust! I like it way better than Chicago Pizzas gluten free deep dish.

detailedReviews.author: Ryan
detailedReviews.text: I love the pizza here. Highly recommend it

detailedReviews.author: Jonathan Becks
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôd love to add a photo of my pizza and chubbies, but truth be told, they are already gone. I‚Äôm a native of Michigan, and a friend of mine (also from Michigan) recommended Fat Chris‚Äôs to me and said this was potentially the best place in Chicago to enjoy a legit Detroit-style pizza. He wasn‚Äôt wrong! There are two other places my Michigan friends have suggested to me in Chicago for authentic Detroit pizza, but Fat Chris‚Äôs is so good, I haven‚Äôt wanted to try anywhere else. The sauce is perfect, and cheese melts over the sides just right. The Goods pizza is my personal favorite, and you‚Äôve got to try the chubbies (pepperoni rolls) with ranch dressing.

detailedReviews.author: Heidi Hatten
detailedReviews.text: Fat Chris‚Äôs never disappoints!  The service is always top notch, their food is AmAzInG, and we love supporting this local small business.  Their Gluten Free Pizza is the best I‚Äôve ever had - Detroit Style.  Whether it‚Äôs take out, delivery, or eating inside their welcoming space, I highly recommend Fat Chris‚Äôs!

detailedReviews.author: Stephen Speck
detailedReviews.text: The herby pizza was amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Tyler DePatis
detailedReviews.text: I love Fat Chris‚Äôs almost always get pick up or delivery when I‚Äôm in the neighborhood! Best Detroit style pizza in the city

detailedReviews.author: Eve Roberts
detailedReviews.text: The cashiers are directionless with no self agency- sad!

detailedReviews.author: Kaitlin Leone
detailedReviews.text: Always hits the spot!! Their Detroit style pizza is so good and the motor city cheese sticks are unbeatable!! So good and will keep coming back again and again! üçïüß°

detailedReviews.author: Bob R.
detailedReviews.text: Ordered a sausage Detroit style two weeks ago and it was a game changer.  Crust and cheese were packed with flavor.  Reordered today and it was like it was from a different place.   Bland and tasteless.   Love this place but they need to work on consistency.

detailedReviews.author: Roman Shuster
detailedReviews.text: Amazing pizza. My introduction to Detroit style which is a legitimate delicious pizza style

detailedReviews.author: Rachael Dingle
detailedReviews.text: This place is a GEM! The dough is so pillowy on the #chubbyrolls and garlic knots. The pizza didn't disappoint either!

detailedReviews.author: Mary Godlewski
detailedReviews.text: Had a to-go Detroit style pizza with sausage, mushroom and banana peppers. Love the caramelized crust. Sign up for text messages for good deals. Full disclosure: I won this pizza through a text message contest. Thanks Fat Chris's!

detailedReviews.author: Ryan Moloney
detailedReviews.text: Great staff, excellent pizza, this spot‚Äôs hard to beat. If you‚Äôre from Michigan and missing Faygo or Vernors they have a case full. Beer on tap, and you cannot beat the prices. If you‚Äôre looking to a low key pizza spot, stop looking and head here :)

detailedReviews.author: Mark Tower
detailedReviews.text: Fat Chris's Pizza is in a word "Fantastic". If you haven't been there you are missing out on great Detroit style pizza. Also, they have one of the greatest creations known to man. They are called Chubbies, and they are more than fantastic, possibly transcendent. They look a bit like a croissant ü•ê but that's where the similarities end. They are in actuality, Garlic bread with Pepperoni and cheese folded and baked to damn near perfection.  Worth driving there just to try these, but you'd be missing out on great pizza if you just did that. Go now...literally.

detailedReviews.author: Wishdocta
detailedReviews.text: Best Detroit style pizza in Chicago hands down! Plus Faygo and Bettermade always available...

detailedReviews.author: Jack Snodgrass
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in Chicago. Would be honored to buy some merch.

detailedReviews.author: K M
detailedReviews.text: Great quality and perfect Detroit style crust

detailedReviews.author: Abby Hoffmeyer
detailedReviews.text:
I've never dined in at Fat Chris's so I can't actually speak on atmosphere, but I love the Detroit style pizza. I order delivery regularly and it always is correct & delivered earlier than the ETA.
I got the 8 slice Detroit style with giardinara & the cheesysticks and both were üî•üî•. & yes, all that was just for me, even though I was beyond full after a few breadsticks & a slice. With delivery fee, tax, and tip it was ~$40 and I'll get at least 3 meals out of it. Cheaper than Jets with a crispier crust, which I love.

detailedReviews.author: Tabatha Peterson
detailedReviews.text: Fat Chris pizza is Amazing.  Fresh toppings, perfect sauce!  Get the Goods or the Buffalo chicken on the Detroit style you will NOT be disappointed!

detailedReviews.author: Eliza Stoughton
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza ever

detailedReviews.author: Michael Countryman
detailedReviews.text: I love this place. I‚Äôve never eaten in, but carry out is always fast, the staff is always friendly, and the pizza is always great! This was my first Detroit style pizza experience and I love it, I‚Äôm sold!

detailedReviews.author: James Hubert
detailedReviews.text: Killer Detroit style pizza!!! My favorite is ‚ÄòThe Works‚Äô! And the chubbies!!?!? To die for

detailedReviews.author: Justin Okray
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely spot on Detroit style pizza. Sauce on top where it belongs. Gooey/chewy bread with a perfectpy snappy crispy crust. Faygo cans adds to that Detroit nostalgia. I recommend this place to all our friends, it has quickly become our favorite pizza place in the city.

detailedReviews.author: Sean O'Connell
detailedReviews.text: Great neighborhood pizza spot in the neighborhood. No frills' and great food!

detailedReviews.author: Michael Ian
detailedReviews.text: The Buffalo Chicken and The Goods Detroit style are incredible. This is my favorite Detroit style in Chicago

detailedReviews.author: Jacob Patterson
detailedReviews.text:
I‚Äôve been looking for a good Detroit style pizza in Chicago for a long time, and Fat Chris‚Äôs is definitely the place to go! The pizza was cooked perfectly and was ready quickly.

The prices are also pretty reasonable. I would recommend everyone try it out!

detailedReviews.author: Richard Ekins
detailedReviews.text: Everything ive gotten sofar has been delicious

detailedReviews.author: Matthew Lozano
detailedReviews.text: Highly recommend this gem in Andersonville. The Chubbies (Pepperoni Rolls) with ranch and marinara are a crazy good appetizer. We'd never had Detroit-Style pizza before, and The Goods was phenomenal!

detailedReviews.author: Britten Wolff
detailedReviews.text: Fat Chris‚Äôs is a super solid detroit style pie.

detailedReviews.author: Landry Jackson
detailedReviews.text: Service was quick for dinning in. Quality was great. Perfect crust. Bathroom clean. Dinning room clean, TVs, good music.

detailedReviews.author: Adam Jude
detailedReviews.text: Great Detroit style pizza. Only reason I knocked a star was because the sauce on top Detroit style drizzle just didn't work with the BBQ sauce they use. Way too much sweetness concentrated into one bite. Other than that it was awesome. Def will ask for light sauce next time.

detailedReviews.author: Andrea Augustinas-Metz
detailedReviews.text: Did not know this spot was here until the other day when we stopped in - turned out to be a great choice! The pizza was incredible (and I love having a local alternative to Jets for Detroit-style), and all the staff we encountered were kind and enthusiastic. Highly recommend, especially for dine-in if you‚Äôre in the area, it‚Äôs a comfortable no-frills space, aka perfect for chowing down on some pizza.

detailedReviews.author: alex bernstein
detailedReviews.text: Best Detroit style!

detailedReviews.author: Sam Bottoms
detailedReviews.text:
Really great option for Detroit style pizza. The recommended cheesy bread was excellent, if you're a fan of Faygo, this is one of the free places I've seen it in the city.

My favorite was the Samoan though both the Hawaiian and Carnie were great as well. Their sauce is sweet rather than savory just as a heads up.

The restaurant is unassuming but has a distinct character with why brick walls and fun decor.

Service was great with helpful and cheerful staff.

detailedReviews.author: Ozzy Baker
detailedReviews.text: Okay, so you want to get a really good pizza and can‚Äôt decide on deep dish or thin. Their pan style pizza menu is unique and polished to perfection. Tangy, sweet red tomato sauce. Incredible crispy flaky bread and some daym good cheese. Definitely meant to order out. For best experience get it for pick up, pies take 30 mins to cook. Enjoy!

detailedReviews.author: A K
detailedReviews.text: Great apps and pizza. Bread and crusts were perfectly soft yet had some crisp!

detailedReviews.author: Lee Applewhite
detailedReviews.text: Chubbiest were very good. Buffalo wings were good but definitely spicy. Detroit style pizza was ü§å

detailedReviews.author: Ingrid Perlongo
detailedReviews.text:
I like the warehouse vibe and laid back, fun ambiance.

Very nice cashier.

The pizza was bready but in a good way. The tomato sauce lacked zest and flavor but was fresh. The brisket was too salty but was tender.
The pizza wasn't perfect but I'll still give five stars because of the freshness and quality of ingredients.

Excellent salad and balsamic vinaigrette.

detailedReviews.author: A S
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôm really irritated. First time ordering, and it came looking like that. A simple hand tossed, cheese pizza. Why would anyone serve that? I‚Äôd rather my order be late and delicious, than early and practically inedible. It tasted and looked burnt to the point of dehydrated. I‚Äôve never been served a pizza like that. Quality control goes a long way y‚Äôall.

detailedReviews.author: Adrian D
detailedReviews.text: I was here to pick up a food order as a delivery driver however they did not let me use the bathroom and we‚Äôre very rude as a result. I told them I‚Äôm going to cancel the order and I told the customer that he is going to starve because of how the lady was. It is a shame because I just moved to the area and I am all for supporting small businesses, however simply not letting delivery drivers use the bathroom when customers can use the bathroom is not OK because at the end of the day without the delivery drivers those customers would not be ordering from your store I guess since we are 1099 workers with that exact same logic, you are using as the owner that I guess if some construction workers are doing some work in your shop or if anyone else is doing work to improve your shop who aren‚Äôt your employees and are customers I guess they shouldn‚Äôt be allowed to use the bathroom either which would be ridiculous. You not letting construction workers working on your own shop to use your bathroom because they are not your employees. Let‚Äôs do the math how much money you lost out on me and my roommates eat out about twice a week at least for pizza. Multiply an extra large pizza by the amount of weeks in a year and that‚Äôs how much money you lost. Which is easily thousands of dollars. I also told the customer they didn‚Äôt let me use the bathroom and they instructed me over the phone they would no longer order from your shop. With that attitude hopefully you will close soon rather get little Cesar‚Äôs then you guys.

detailedReviews.author: Bermet Erkinova
detailedReviews.text: you better change the cashier and hire a more humane employee, he looks down on you as if he doesn‚Äôt get a measly $15 an hour, please, if you are reading this, be more polite with customers, because you are not the navel of the world‚ù§Ô∏è

detailedReviews.author: Scarlett Whitton
detailedReviews.text:
Great Pizza! First time I've had Detroit style, it was yummy.

I wish you had at least one zero soda option though

detailedReviews.author: Tomie Strong
detailedReviews.text: The food is really good and pretty cheap I had the cheesy bread

detailedReviews.author: Nicole Meunier
detailedReviews.text: As Michigander in Chicago, this is my go to place. WAY better than Jets.

detailedReviews.author: Josiah Fast
detailedReviews.text: I'm a bit of a Detroit Style aficionado (I'm a professional chef that owned a Detroit Style Pizza place) and this is the real deal. Perfect caramelization on the edges. Love the sauce. They have Vernors and Faygo. We ordered take out and everything was great. My wife isn't the biggest fan of tomatoes or sauce, so I asked for sauce only on one side and they obliged. We loved the chubbies. You have to order some chubbies. Million stars.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.5/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the delicious Detroit-style pizza, particularly the square pies with toasted cheese edges, which are considered the best in the city. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The staff is consistently described as attentive, polite, and friendly, enhancing the overall dining experience. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
The restaurant offers a unique and creative menu with items like buffalo chicken pizza with brisket and chubbies, which are a hit among customers. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews and reputation issues, including poor customer service and inconsistent food quality - review management can address this concern
Poor customer service experiences, such as rude interactions and dismissive behavior - social media marketing can improve this area
Inconsistent food quality and preparation issues, such as stale bread and burnt pizza - Boostly marketing services can improve this

positive.text: We went in with my fianc√©e when we were out for a walk, they cook very tasty and quickly

positive.author: Christina Kneitz
positive.text: Delicious pizza and terrific staff! Love being able to watch Detroit sports! And playing the Lions fight song is the cherry on topüíô

positive.text: Attentive, polite staff and the best damn Detroit pizza in the city. Honestly, one of the best pizzas in the city, period. Their thin crust is good too, but their square pies are the star of the show. The toasted cheese on the edge somehow tastes better than any other place that does it.

negative.author: R. Flores
negative.text:
I live in the neighborhood. I‚Äôve eaten here quite a few times. Today was my last visit.

I placed a pick up order on DoorDash. I walked to the restaurant and arrived about 2 minutes before my order was supposed to be ready. The place was completely empty and the front door was locked. I called the restaurant and someone hung up on me. I called a second time and asked whether the place was open. The owner replied ‚ÄúUgh, yeah‚Ä¶‚Äù in a condescending tone, as if I were crazy for asking. I informed him his front door was locked.

When the owner came to open the door, another delivery driver had arrived. We walked into the empty restaurant and the owner told the delivery driver, ‚ÄúYour order will be ready in about 4 minutes, you can have a seat.‚Äù He told me, ‚ÄúYour order will be ready in about 6 minutes, please wait outside.‚Äù I asked him whether it was necessary for me to go outside and he told me that when an order takes more than 6 minutes to complete, he asks people to wait in their car. I wanted to explain to him that I didn‚Äôt have a car and that I‚Äôm a returning customer from the neighborhood, but he stormed off after he finished his statement.

Again, the restaurant was empty. There were plenty of empty chairs. Instead, I stood outside his front door and nobody came to inform me my order was ready.

This owner seems checked out.

negative.author: Jos√© David Caceres Hidalgo
negative.text: I had a bad experience here. Apparently, the food preparation isn't the best. It gave me indigestion. I could also talk about the poor customer service. If you want to come here to eat and then leave sick, don't hesitate to visit this cheap pizzeria.

negative.author: Theresa S
negative.text:
The owners response is now another reason to never be back.

Hair in food and serving stale bread is acceptable them and then they bully customers who notify the public about it.

Look at their other 1 star reviews, they berate anyone who dares say they received poor service here. This is a winning strategy I'm sure.

Thanks for taking my money though. I'm sure I'll never see the refund you promised for the hot dog that ended up in the trash with the poppers, and for ruining my dinner after working a 12 hour shift.

-----------------------------------

We‚Äôve ordered from here occasionally for the last three years. Tonight will be the last. Before we always ordered pizza and had no issues, but tonight decided on hot dogs and appetizers instead.

The Chicago dog bun was stale and the jalape√±o poppers had hair in the ranch dressing and was in the package with the poppers.

I did call about the hot dog and they offered to refund that. Unfortunately I went to try the poppers afterwards and found the hair.

I‚Äôm sorry but this is so gross and unacceptable, we will never be back.
